snippet: A group of 27 countries on the United Nations Human Rights Council expressed concerns on Friday over the Egyptian government’s wide-scale use of violence against opposition protesters, the first reprimand from the international body since a bloody...
abstract: Group of 27 countries on United Nations Human Rights Council express concerns over Egyptian government’s wide-scale use of violence against opposition protesters, first reprimand from UN since bloody crackdown on dissent in the country began in 2013.
lead_paragraph: A group of 27 countries on the United Nations Human Rights Council expressed concerns on Friday over the Egyptian government’s wide-scale use of violence against opposition protesters, the first reprimand from the international body since a bloody crackdown on dissent in the country began last year.

headline.main: U.N. Body Criticizes Egyptian Crackdown on Dissent
headline.print_headline: Egypt: U.N. Body Criticizes Crackdown on Dissent
